lvmisc 0.0.0.9000

Classify body mass index (BMI) category

Source: R/bmi.R
bmi_cat.Rd

bmi_cat returns the element-wise BMI category as factor with 6 levels:

  • Underweight (18.5 < BMI)

  • Normal weight (18.5 \(\le\) BMI < 25)

  • Overweight (25 \(\le\) BMI < 30)

  • Obesity class I (30 \(\le\) BMI < 35)

  • Obesity class II (35 \(\le\) BMI < 40)

  • Obesity class III (40 \(\le\) BMI)

bmi_cat(bmi)

Arguments

bmi

A numeric vector with BMI data. BMI unit must be meters per square meter.

See also

bmi()

Examples

mass <- sample(50:100, 20)
height <- rnorm(20, mean = 1.7, sd = 0.2)
bmi <- bmi(mass, height)

bmi_cat(bmi)
#>  [1] Obesity class I  Overweight       Normal weight    Normal weight   
#>  [5] Obesity class II Underweight      Normal weight    Overweight      
#>  [9] Underweight      Normal weight    Underweight      Underweight     
#> [13] Overweight       Underweight      Underweight      Overweight      
#> [17] Overweight       Obesity class II Obesity class I  Normal weight   
#> 6 Levels: Underweight Normal weight Overweight ... Obesity class III
